82FF833FEB1944E8B919BCB369B53972.description: Create an accessory for wardrobe (e.g., scarves, hair accessories, mitts, jewelry).

8C532D90916C400E828D416EFE6A4E46.description: Investigate the evolution and change of accessories over time.

457C47FFFC53468A8FAD38618C22BC01.description: Explore accessories from a variety of cultural perspectives.

2752E22D783549169BFB2BDB8346981D.description: Explore how accessories can enhance a wardrobe.

367B3775A146487092EA98959C4167C4.description: Plan a wardrobe for a specific need (e.g., new job, special trip, stage of life) of an individual and present finding to the class.

9458903459D7419FB23DA1729D82CDBA.description: Examine various wardrobe organizational tips (e.g., colour coding, categorizing, decluttering).

C14962B6927F4C8F92B72DD9DDC923C2.description: Investigate financial considerations in wardrobe purposes (e.g., fashion trends, fads, designer clothes, capsule wardrobes).

958414CFBE9147CEBABF5E45413E7B68.description: Explore the factors involved in wardrobe planning (e.g., packing for a trip, lifestyle, professional dress, season changes, culture-based considerations).

F9D8840B5B9D44FF9A076F318EC3D622.description: Investigate elements of planning a wardrobe.

F707B024E47C44EBBE13A34075143121.description: Explore traditional, cultural and contemporary materials and methods of textile embellishment (e.g., First Nations and Métis beading, applique, embroidery, painting, batik, rhinestoning).

50E8AC0E9F324D7FB25DDA0B17C83214.description: Discuss the importance of mending to support economic and environment sustainability.

2073F3616EA745E3A6D3FF62AE206E1C.description: Redesign a garment/textile item to serve a new purpose (e.g., jeans into a skirt, shirt into a pillow, clothes into a patchwork quilt).

35D30D63600F46C1AD4A8ADEFF43E5DB.description: Explore the ways clothing/textile items may be sustained (e.g., restored, redesigned, recycled).

48E039A4F2134D4EB945CCA4EF5ED907.description: Investigate the economic (e.g., over buying, fast fashion) and environmental (e.g., clothing in landfills) impact of clothing and textile decisions.

DA57D3A7D57F46A5B6549CF71778B23F.description: Create an awareness of ways clothing and textiles can be sustained.

2BEA43CA105B44A1A986EAFF3AA69491.description: Research norms, social cues and messages associated with clothing choices.

4B116B4798CA4B4E96935D64AB848EE8.description: Explore the relationship between apparel choices and an individual’s culture, lifestyle, resources, needs, wants and values.

DDED8E0F6DB14C34AA33B28A475B55BD.description: Examine factors that reflect individual choices in apparel (e.g., modesty, protection, culture, price, function).

FED852E55AB04A6E8397FA36166DF8E3.description: Investigate how clothing fulfills physical, psychological, social and aesthetic needs.

B09114BD75C141DAB5F025FA513F2AB4.description: Identify and understand the elements of design and terminology associated with line, colour, shape/form, space, texture and pattern.

925961D509C147BEA1A5A8BBDD05B2B5.description: Explore how textiles are created and/or changed for appropriate consumer use.

95838D5AF7AE412A813BC42A554410B3.description: Discuss the environmental impact (e.g., detergents, dry cleaning chemicals, micro-fibers) during textile care, including eco-friendly options.

69FC9139BCA14231B3FA1A975F6E51B3.description: Explore the Canadian mandatory and voluntary textile care labeling information (e.g., fiber content; care symbols).

4E047E75D9804EAA863E98E29444F623.description: Create a representation (e.g., display, brochure, video, presentation software, oral presentation) to communicate research findings related to clothing, textiles and fashion occupations.

EA5F1FCFF51E46CEA617FD5B8F3BE89F.description: Examine roles, responsibilities, educational qualifications and personal and professional qualities common to people involved in clothing, textiles and fashion related jobs.

AA7365DC5F7D4D9EA858743FF19D8B8E.description: Explore connections between topics in clothing, textiles and fashion and occupations of personal interest.

727618293E8246F2B99E4194CD2491B6.description: Participate in events such as career fairs or job shadows to learn more about career opportunities in clothing, textiles and fashion.

922B6D78AEF5481284ABA9FC46DE6D00.description: Research educational institutions that offer required educational qualifications in clothing, textiles and fashion.

9098EC9B956C48ADB1EE700AC281658C.description: Generate a list of occupations that require a background in clothing, textiles and fashion.

2E56180B004F4DFD9FBC058FE083AA99.description: Demonstrate safe use of an iron or steamer.

49CA91FAAF144CC783D5F065C35EE9DD.description: Explore basic sewing techniques and construction details.
